item.description:
Thursday nights from 5-9PM the Institute for Contemporary Art on South Boston's Waterfront provides free admission to all patrons. We can head over to the gallery after work, browse the art.

When we have finished browsing the art, we'll walk a few blocks to Legal Seafood's Test Kitchen for a luscious but reasonably-priced meal. The restaurants website punfully boasts: "Legal Test Kitchen (LTK) ventures into uncharted waters and pushes the boundaries of innovation in premium food and drink. Multicultural dining options and inspired seasonal cocktails cast a wide net in attracting those who have an appetite for fun." The dinner will be Dutch treat so we can either split the bill or get separate checks.
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing a Meet-up name tag and pretending to understand what the paintings mean.
item.name: Culture, Cocktails, and Conversation
